etymology.description: 金(金) (jīn, "metal") + 咼(咼) (guō, phonetic) = metal vessel
etymology.interpretation: The character 鍋 (guō, "pot") combines the metal radical 金(金) (jīn, "metal") with the phonetic component 咼(咼) (guō). This illustrates its association with metal as many pots or cooking vessels are traditionally made of metal.

examples.chinese: 我买了一口新鍋(我買了一口新鍋)，准备煮火锅(準備煮火鍋)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ mǎile yīkǒu xīn guō, zhǔnbèi zhǔ huǒguō.
examples.english: I bought a new pot and am preparing to cook hotpot.

examples.chinese: 厨房里的鍋很耐用(廚房裡的鍋很耐用)。
examples.pinyin: Chúfáng lǐ de guō hěn nàiyòng.
examples.english: The pot in the kitchen is very durable.
